channel.title: BD News - Dhaka Tribune
channel.description: Latest news from Bangladeshi newspapers (20 articles)

item.title: New books for primary students arrive in Rajshahi
item.description: New textbooks have started arriving at primary and secondary schools in Rajshahi. According to the education office, 100 percent of primary-level textbooks have already reached Rajshahi. However, all secondary-level books have not yet arrived here. In the first phase, all...

item.title: BNP to clear all waste from 300 Feet Road Friday
item.description: Dhaka North BNP will remove all waste from the &lsquo;July 36 Expressway&rsquo; (300 Feet Road) following the &lsquo;historic return home&rsquo; of BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman. The information was shared with the media on Thursday evening by Professor Dr Moudud Hossain...

item.title: Tarique Rahman to visit Ziaur Rahman’s grave Friday
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman will visit the grave of Ziaur Rahman in Sher-e-Bangla Nagar on Friday, on the second day after his return to the country, following the Juma prayers. He will later travel to the National Martyrs&rsquo; Memorial in Savar to pay tribute to the...

item.title: Fakhrul: We will win next election under Tarique Rahman’s leadership
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir has said that under the leadership of Tarique Rahman, they ousted a fascist regime on August 5, 2024 and successfully navigated a difficult political journey. Expressing confidence, he said that, God willing, the party...

item.title: Cold wave continues in northern region disrupting normal
item.description: The mild cold wave sweeping across northern region of the country continued for the third consecutive day on Thursday, affecting normal life. While maximum temperatures rose slightly, minimum temperatures remained mostly unchanged, keeping the chill intact. The sky stayed...

item.title: Political leaders react to Tarique Rahman’s homecoming
item.description: Leaders of major political parties and movements across Bangladesh on Thursday welcomed the return of BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman after 17 years in exile, describing his homecoming as a significant moment in the country&rsquo;s democratic struggle rather than a personal...

item.title: 302, including former home minister, sued over attempted murder case
item.description: A case of attempted murder dating back to July 2024 has been refiled in Bogra, naming 302 people as accused, including former Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal. The case was lodged on Wednesday at Sadar Police Station by Md. Alif (25), son of Nur Hossain Mandal of West...

item.title: ‘Dear Bangladesh’: Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years
item.description: After 17 years and three months in exile, BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman returned to Bangladesh on Thursday, marking one of the most significant political homecomings in recent years. A Biman Bangladesh Airlines flight (BG-202) carrying Tarique Rahman landed at Hazrat...

item.title: Five AL men held in Moulvibazar
item.description: Law enforcement agencies have arrested five leaders and activists of Awami League in Moulvibazar district on Thursday. The arrestees are: Russell Ahmed (33), Religious Affairs Secretary of Barlekha Upazila Swechchhasebak League; Tota Mia (65), Religious Affairs Secretary of...

item.title: GUBT honors female students at Aparajita Hall farewell ceremony
item.description: A farewell ceremony for the female students of Aparajita Hall at Gopalganj University of Science and Technology (GUBT) was held on Wednesday evening at a restaurant in Gopalganj town. The event was presided over by Aparajita Hall Provost Dr Rehena Parveen, while the...

item.title: Journalists form human chain in Khulna protesting attacks on Prothom Alo, Daily Star
item.description: Journalists in Khulna on Wednesday afternoon formed a human chain protesting the attacks, vandalism and arson at the offices of the country's two leading newspapers -- Prothom Alo and The Daily Star-- and demanding an end to harassment of media workers. The programme was held...

item.title: 3-day art camp launched in Naogaon
item.description: Naogaon hosted its first-ever three-day art camp on Thursday at Muktir Mor Zilla Parishad Park, organized by Visual Arts Naogaon. Veteran painter Rezaul Haque inaugurated the event. Among those present were KEDIAN President Anisur Rahman, Badruzzaman, former principal...

item.title: Christmas Day celebrated in Rajshahi
item.description: Christmas Day, the largest religious festival of the Christian community, was celebrated here with much enthusiasm and festive mood on Thursday. Churches hold midnight mass and special morning prayers for Jesus Christ, seeking global peace and prosperity, with large...

item.title: 15 Ashrayan homes left abandoned in Shibganj
item.description: Fifteen homes built at Kanchithal village in Shibganj upazila of Bogra under the Ashrayan project have remained abandoned. The beneficiaries gradually left the houses over the past year, leaving them unused. As the families now live elsewhere, bushes and wild vegetation have...

item.title: Six more held over lynching of Hindu youth in Mymensingh
item.description: Police have arrested six more people during a raid at Bhaluka upazila in Mymensingh on Thursday in connection with the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das in Mymensingh district on 18 December. The arrestees are Takbir, 22, of Sunamganj; Ruhul Amin, 42, of Thakurgaon; Nur Alam, 33,...

item.title: Youth found dead in Barguna
item.description: Police recovered the hanging body of a youth from Amtali upazila of Barguna district on Wednesday night. The deceased was identified as Md Limon, 21, a tenant at a house owned by Tahsin Molla in Khontakata area, adjacent to Baitul Aman Jame Mosque under Ward No. 3 of Amtali...

item.title: Nation marks Christmas with devotion, festive cheer
item.description: Christmas Day, commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ, was celebrated across Bangladesh on Thursday with religious devotion, colourful festivities and renewed calls for peace, compassion and communal harmony. Churches across the country were illuminated with decorative...

item.title: 33 candidates collect nomination papers in Khulna
item.description: A total of 33 candidates from eight political parties have, so far, collected nomination papers in six parliamentary constituencies of Khulna ahead of the upcoming 13th national elections. Of them, 10 candidates are from the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), six from...

item.title: Month-long textile, cottage industries fair begins in Rajshahi
item.description: A month-long textile and cottage industries fair began in Rajshahi on Thursday with the call for bolstering the economic condition of the region through the revival of handloom and cottage goods productioin. Women Entrepreneurs Association of Bangladesh (WEAB) is...

item.title: Dhaka shivers at season’s lowest temperature
item.description: Dhaka experienced the coldest day of the season on Thursday as fog and chilly winds swept across the capital, intensifying the wintery feel. The Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD) recorded the city&rsquo;s lowest temperature at 14.2&deg;C. Temperatures will...
